description: Spyro 3 is a game about a purple dragon who likes eggs.

0.5.2.title: V0.5.2

1.0.0.description:
# Spyro 3 - Year of the Dragon (2000) - Public Release v1.0.0
This is the initial beta/stable release of an APWorld and Client for Spyro 3 for PSX.  This supports only NTSC-U version 1.1 (US release Greatest Hits label) of the original game and requires Windows and Duckstation to play.

Release: https://github.com/ArsonAssassin/S3AP/releases/tag/1.0.0
Setup and Requirements: https://github.com/ArsonAssassin/S3AP/blob/main/README.md

## What Checks are Supported?
All 150 eggs
25%, 50%, 75%, and/or 100% of gems in each level (optional)
Every 500 total gems, to a user specified maximum (optional)
Skill Points (optional)
Life Bottles (optional)

## What Goals are Possible?
Defeat the Sorceress in her Lair with 100+ eggs
Chase Moneybags around Midnight Mountain
Defeat the Sorceress in Super Bonus Round
Obtain all 20 skill points
Complete the epilogue by defeating the Sorceress in her lair and obtaining all 20 skill points

## What's in the Item Pool?
All 150 eggs
Sparx Powerups (optional)
Moneybags Unlocks, including the companion characters (optional)
World Keys, locking progression to the next hub world (optional)
Progressive Sparx Health Upgrades, allowing you to start with lower max HP for a challenge (optional)
Miscellaneous Fun/Helpful Items (pick which to include)
Extra Lives
Temporary Invincibility
Sparx Heal
Change Spyro's Color
Big Head Mode and Flat Spyro Mode
Miscellaneous Traps (pick which to include)
Sparx Damage Trap
Sparxless Trap
Lag Trap

## What other features are there?
11 Tutorial Zoes across Sunrise Spring give hints for the seed
Easy Difficulty option for some of the most annoying challenges
Customizable trick logic
1.0.0.title: V1.0.0

1.1.0.description:
NOTE: This release is NOT compatible with version 1.0.1 and earlier. Trying to use this client with a previous APWorld (or vice versa) will break location checks.

Features:
- Partial Gemsanity - 200 gems, picked at random, become checks. Items of 50 or 100 gems for a given level are added to the item pool.  SBR is not included.
  - When used with Hwd's randomizer, this may require skipping Moneybags in most locations.
- New Goals - Spike and 36 eggs, Scorch and 65 eggs, and Egg Hunt (ala Triforce Hunt).
  - In Egg Hunt, the egg pool is reduced as you look for a number of eggs between 10 and 100. Portal entry requirements are reduced accordingly.
- Tweak Sparx logic options based on community feedback.
  - When gemsanity and progressive Sparx health logic are on, and Sparx Finder is required for 100% gems, the player starts with Sparx finder to avoid logic issues.
- Tries to start the client in Windows admin mode automatically.
- Displays an error message if the player is using Spyro 3 version 1.0 instead of 1.1.  Attempts to prevent sending out any checks if the game version is not NTSC-U 1.1.
- Add easier Scorch fight option.

Bug Fixes
- Improve client performance when connecting late in an async.
- Fix bug where life bottle and Zoe hint checks could be lost permanently.
- Fix bug where the third world key was not needed.
- Fix bug where, in Moneybagssanity, a rhynoc in Cloud Spires could spawn inside a bellow.
- Forces full accessibility, since Spyro 3 does not make sense with lower levels.
1.1.0.title: v1.1.0

1.1.0-rc1.description:
# Spyro 3 AP Version 1.1.0 Release Candidate 1

Release: https://github.com/Uroogla/S3AP/releases/tag/1.1.0-rc1

This is an alpha/test build.  It can and probably will break, perhaps spectacularly.  For the latest stable release, please see https://github.com/Uroogla/S3AP/releases/tag/1.0.1

This release is NOT compatible with previous versions.  Trying to use this client with a previous APWorld (or vice versa) will break location checks.

Features:
- Partial Gemsanity - 200 gems, picked at random, become checks.  Items of 50 or 100 gems for a given level are added to the item pool.
- New Goals - Spike and 36 eggs, Scorch and 65 eggs, and Egg Hunt (ala Triforce Hunt).
  - In Egg Hunt, the egg pool is reduced as you look for a number of eggs between 10 and 100.  Portal entry requirements are reduced accordingly.  This is not compatible with full accessibility and will override that setting.
- Tweak Sparx logic options based on community feedback.
- Tries to start in admin mode automatically.
- Add easier Scorch fight option.

Bug Fixes
- Improve client performance when connecting late in an async.
- Fix bug where life bottle and Zoe hint checks could be lost permanently.
- Fix bug where the third world key was not needed.
1.1.0-rc1.title: [DEPRECATED] Spyro 3 Archipelago - Version 1.1.0 Release Candidate 1

1.1.0-rc2.description:
# Spyro 3 AP Version 1.1.0 Release Candidate 2

Release: https://github.com/Uroogla/S3AP/releases/tag/1.1.0-rc2
For previous changelog, see: https://github.com/Uroogla/S3AP/releases/tag/1.1.0-rc1

This is an alpha/test build.  It can and probably will break, perhaps spectacularly.  For the latest stable release, please see https://github.com/Uroogla/S3AP/releases/tag/1.0.1

This release is NOT compatible with previous versions.  Trying to use this client with a previous APWorld (or vice versa) will break some checks.

Bug Fixes
- Fix Spooky Swamp Gemsanity logic
- Fix incorrect portal logic for egg hunt
- Force full accessibility regardless of player settings, since Spyro 3 conceptually does not make sense with minimal accessibility.  This removes the Sorceress, Bugbot Factory, and Super Bonus Round as checks during Egg Hunt.
1.1.0-rc2.title: Spyro 3 Archipelago - Version 1.1.0 Release Candidate 2

1.2.0.description:
This release contains both APWorld and client changes.

Features:
- Open World Mode
  - Player starts with access to all 4 homeworlds
  - The end of level eggs for 15 levels and 3 bosses are autocompleted.
    - This means the player may access shortcuts within most levels and side areas for Sheila, Sgt. Byrd, and Bentley before accessing those levels.
    - Buzz, Spike, and Scorch do not need to be defeated.
  - Shortly after connecting, the client will show you receiving those checks (all filler) and may cause Spyro to take a death to update the homeworld.
- Level Entry Requirements Randomizer Option
  - Vanilla - Egg requirements are unchanged from the original game.
  - Keys - Each speedway and non-companion main level requires an item to unlock.  You choose how many to start with.
  - Randomize Requirements - Levels normally requiring eggs to unlock have their requirements shuffled.
  - Add Requirements - Levels that do not normally require eggs may have egg requirements added.  Companion levels, homeworlds, bosses, and Sparx levels never had egg requirements added.
  - Add Gem Requirements - As Add Requirements, but egg requirements may be replaced with egg requirements as well.  Only works when Moneybagssanity and Gemsanity are on.
  - The Atlas and portals show locked levels, with requirements if applicable
  - Use the `showUnlockedLevels` command to see which levels are unlocked
  - For all modes but Vanilla, the player starts with 1 egg due to limitations in portal requirements.  This impacts egg hunt seeds with low requirements.
- Beta support for NTSC-U version 1.0
- Support Universal Tracker
- Starting in 1.2.0, the client will flag if it does not match the host's APWorld version
- "Normal Spyro" filler item, which resets color change and Big Head/Flat Spyro mode

Changes:
- (Over)heal Sparx item can raise health up to 5 instead of 4
- Allow Egg Hunts of over 100 eggs
- Changed total gem logic when Gemsanity is off to prevent impossible seeds
  - Total Gem Checks will not be in logic until later in seeds, though you can still complete them as before.  Universal Tracker will list some of these checks as being in "Glitched Logic"
- Removed support for hwd's standalone randomizer to streamline logic

Bug Fixes:
- Progressive Client Stability Improvements
- Fix bug where Midnight Mountain access did not check world key count
- Fix price bug when Moneybags is vanilla and Gemsanity is on
- Fix Gemsanity bug where 1 gem in Sunny Villa was mismapped
- Fix Egg for Sale goal sometimes not triggering
- Fix trigger for a Lost Fleet Life Bottle check
- Fix bug where overheal Sparx never worked when starting with blue or green Sparx
- Fix bug where egg hunts would have an extra (inaccessible) egg
- Fixes issue where portals could become available out of logic on reconnecting to AP or collecting a homeworld egg, as long as the level lock option is not vanilla.
1.2.0.title: v1.2.0

1.2.1.description:
This release contains only Client (S3AP.exe) and documentation changes.  It is not necessary to update your APWorld from 1.2.0 unless you are using the documentation files contained inside it.

Bug Fixes
- Fixed a crash when loading into Open World while in control of a companion character.
- Open World mode now shows the Molten and Seashell requirements before you meet them.
  - When Open World mode is off, the 1 egg requirement is to speak with the NPC, not to enter the level.
- Webhost documentation now points to the correct repository.
1.2.1.title: v1.2.1

1.2.2.description:
This release contains both Client (S3AP.exe) and APWorld changes.  It is recommended to update both.
**Note:** This is the minimum APWorld version required to run with Archipelago version 0.7.0+

Improvements
- Add manifest file required for future version of Archipelago.

Bug Fixes:
- Open World Mode no longer displays the release of 33 checks on first connect.
- Changed Open World logic for Spooky Swamp and Charmed Ridge to account for end of level shortcuts.
  - Due to a difficult jump being required to fully clear Cloud Spires, the logic for this level remains unchanged.
- Changed default filler item to Extra Life to fix a bug when item link is on.
- Changed Open World logic to account for beating the Sorceress granting access to earlier companion levels.
- Fixed incorrect gem indices for Sunny Villa (skateboarding area) and Fireworks Factory (throughout)
- Fixed Open World bug where a red gem was impossible to collect in Spooky Swamp.  The gem is granted automatically upon entering the level.
- Fixed bug where connecting to a seed in progress after beating the Sorceress could result in the goal incorrectly being marked as complete.
1.2.2.title: v1.2.2

1.2.3-rc1.description:
This is a release candidate - it has not been thoroughly tested and may be unstable in places. Please be respectful of your fellow players when using this.

**Note that setup instructions have changed slightly with this release.  Within Duckstation, navigate to Settings > Game Properties > Console and select "Interpreter" under "Execution Mode".**

This release contains both Client (S3AP.Desktop.exe) and APWorld changes. It is recommended to update both.

This new client maintains partial compatibility with older versions of the APWorld, meaning you might be able to use it for sessions in progress, depending on your settings.  The following are known incompatibilities:
- The Evening Lake Home life bottle check is broken and can instead be obtained by speaking to the Zoe before the invincibility powerup.
- The goals Sorceress 1, Sorceress 2, Spike, and Scorch will require eggs equal to your YAML file's egg hunt goal to win, even though you are not in Egg Hunt.

New Features:
- Added Item Groups (Moneybags Unlocks, Level Unlocks, Gems) and Location Groups (Speedways, Sparx Levels)
- Allows player to customize the number of eggs required to complete their goal for Sorceress 1, Sorceress 2, Spike, and Scorch.  This setting was formerly used only for Egg Hunt.
  - The setting that determines the percentage of extra eggs still applies only to Egg Hunt.
- Allows player to customize the requirements for the Sorceress and Super Bonus Round doors.
  - Gem requirements for Super Bonus Round may not appear correctly due to limitations in game code.  The door in Midnight rounds up to the next 1000, while doors in Super Bonus Round itself will not show the final digit if less than 10000.
    - As an example, if the setting is set to 6543 gems, the door in Midnight will show 7000 as the requirement, while the doors in Super Bonus Round will show 0754, 0854, 10043, and 11543, respectively

Improvements:
- Added Universal Tracker support for randomized settings.
- Marked checks for which the only missing requirement is additional Sparx Health as being in "glitched logic" in Universal Tracker.
- Added the Zoes in front of the Midday fireball powerup and the Evening invincibility powerup into the pool of Zoes that can give hints.
- Split Easy Skateboarding into 4 separate options: Easy Skateboarding Lizards, Points, Lost Fleet, and Super Bonus Round.
- Progressive Client Improvements.

Bug Fixes:
- Fixed a bug with invincibility items during speedway time attacks.
- Fixed a bug where UT showed Egg for Sale as in logic during egg hunts of under 100 eggs.
- Fixed a bug for game version 1.0 that could affect the max number of eggs the atlas showed for each level.
- Prevented a chance for crashes or save file corruption in the game menu.
- Removed the Haunted Tomb Early Agent 9 option, which could create a permanently missable egg.
- Fixed a bug where the Molten Crater and Seashell Shore doors opened early in Open World mode with Vanilla Level Locks.
1.2.3-rc1.title: v1.2.3 - Release Candidate

1.3.0.description:
**Note that setup instructions have changed slightly with this release. Within Duckstation, navigate to Settings > Game Properties > Console and select "Interpreter" under "Execution Mode".** 

This release contains both Client (S3AP.Desktop.exe) and APWorld changes.

New Features:
- Death Link (Beta support)
- Powerup Locks - Items can be required to unlock the powerup gates across the realm.
- Added Item Groups (Moneybags Unlocks, Level Unlocks, Gems) and Location Groups (Speedways, Speedway Races, Sparx Levels, Skateboarding).  Gems in Sparx Levels may still be required to open Super Bonus Round or for total gem checks.
- Allows player to customize the number of eggs required to complete their goal for Sorceress 1, Sorceress 2, Spike, and Scorch. This setting was formerly used only for Egg Hunt.
  - The setting that determines the percentage of extra eggs still applies only to Egg Hunt.
- Allows player to customize the requirements for the Sorceress and Super Bonus Round doors.
  - Gem requirements for Super Bonus Round may not appear correctly due to limitations in game code. The door in Midnight rounds up to the next 1000, while doors in Super Bonus Round itself will not show the final digit if less than 10000.
  - As an example, if the setting is set to 6543 gems, the door in Midnight will show 7000 as the requirement, while the doors in Super Bonus Round will show 0754, 0854, 10043, and 11543, respectively

Improvements:
- Added Universal Tracker support for randomized settings.
- Marked checks for which the only missing requirement is additional Sparx Health as being in "glitched logic" in Universal Tracker.
- Added the Zoes in front of the Midday fireball powerup and the Evening invincibility powerup into the pool of Zoes that can give hints.
- Split Easy Skateboarding into 4 separate options: Easy Skateboarding Lizards, Points, Lost Fleet, and Super Bonus Round.
- Progressive Client Improvements.

Bug Fixes:
- Fixed a bug with invincibility items during speedway time attacks.
- Fixed a bug where UT showed Egg for Sale as in logic during egg hunts of under 100 eggs.
- Fixed a bug for game version 1.0 that could affect the max number of eggs the atlas showed for each level.
- Prevented a chance for crashes or save file corruption in the game menu.
- Removed the Haunted Tomb Early Agent 9 option, which could create a permanently missable egg.
- Fixed a bug where the Molten Crater and Seashell Shore doors opened early in Open World mode with Vanilla Level Locks.
1.3.0.title: v1.3.0

open_world_test.description:
NOTE: This is a test build.  It very likely has bugs or errors.  Please be considerate of your fellow players when using this.  For the latest stable build, see https://github.com/Uroogla/S3AP/releases/tag/1.1.0

New feature:
- Open World Option
  - This opens up all 4 homeworlds from the start.
  - The end of level egg for all 5 main levels of Sunrise, Midday, and Evening are pre-completed from the start of the seed.  Their items are all "Filler"
  - Buzz, Spike, and Scorch do not need to be defeated.  Their eggs are pre-completed and their items are all "Filler".
  - All levels that normally require eggs to unlock instead require a Level Unlock item.
  - Players start with 1 egg because Spyro 3 portal unlocks are complicated.
  - You may need to enter and exit a Sunrise level once for the rocket to behave properly.  Otherwise, it may be merged with the balloon.
  - In Companionsanity or Moneybagssanity, players start with Sheila, Sgt. Byrd, and Bentley unlocked, due to potential logic issues.  The plan is to change this eventually.
  - If you are in Sunrise when you unlock Molten or Seashell, you may need to enter another level and come back for the unlock to take effect.
  - Not compatible with hwd's randomizer or world keys.
  - Partially ignores Progressive Sparx Health Logic.  You are still guaranteed to have gold sparx in logic by the Sorceress, but unlocked levels like Fireworks do not account for this option.  You are encouraged to start with a higher sparx level than normal in this mode.
open_world_test.title: Open World Test Build

open_world_test_2.description:
New feature:
- Open World Option
  - This opens up all 4 homeworlds from the start.
  - The end of level egg for all 5 main levels of Sunrise, Midday, and Evening are pre-completed from the start of the seed. Their items are all "Filler"
  - Buzz, Spike, and Scorch do not need to be defeated. Their eggs are pre-completed and their items are all "Filler".
  - All levels that normally require eggs to unlock instead require a Level Unlock item.
  - Players start with 1 egg because Spyro 3 portal unlocks are complicated.
  - You may need to enter and exit a Sunrise level once for the rocket to behave properly. Otherwise, it may be merged with the balloon.
  - If you are in Sunrise when you unlock Molten or Seashell, you may need to enter another level and come back for the unlock to take effect.
  - Not compatible with hwd's randomizer or world keys.
  - Partially ignores Progressive Sparx Health Logic. You are still guaranteed to have gold sparx in logic by the Sorceress, but unlocked levels like Fireworks do not account for this option. You are encouraged to start with a higher sparx level than normal in this mode.
  - Use the `showUnlockedLevels` command to see which levels are unlocked.
- Flags if user's client does not match the host's APWorld.

Feature Changes
- Removed support for the standalone S3 randomizer.  Using this with Archipelago will result in incorrect and potentially impossible logic.
- Improved Universal Tracker support
  - Gemsanity check list is now supported
  - Hunter eggs and gems locked by the skateboard are now included in glitched logic.
- Allow Egg Hunts of up to 150 eggs.
  - The item pool will never have more than 150 eggs.
  - Portal egg requirements will never go above their vanilla defaults.

Bug Fixes
- Lost Fleet Under Acid Life Bottle check now works correctly.
- Egg for Sale goal now triggers correctly.
- Improve handling of failed connections to Duckstation and AP server.

Known Issues:
- Portals may open when they should not; this fixes itself when you re-enter the homeworld.
- A red gem in Charmed Ridge near the end of level can drop into the ooze.
open_world_test_2.title: Open World Test Build 2
